data.title: Did OneRepublic Steal a Hook From U2?
data.meta_description: The start of the chorus from West Coast sounds nearly identical to Summer of Love.
data.text:
The start of the chorus from West Coast sounds nearly identical to Summer of Love.

I grew up with the music of U2. For a band that has been releasing hits since 1980, it’s safe to say that many people have been influenced by the smooth guitar rhythms from The Edge and the soulful vocals of Bono.

However, over the past 15 years, I’ve also really enjoyed listening to the wide variety of music that OneRepublic has produced. Ryan Tedder, the band’s lead vocalist, is one of the most talented songwriters in the history of music.

If you aren’t aware, look him up! He’s not only written huge hits for his own band, but also for several others, including Taylor Swift, One Direction, Lady Gaga, Jennifer Lopez, Maroon 5, Katy Perry, Ed Sheeran, and several others — including U2.

That’s why I was shocked the other day while listening to West Coast, a popular song released by OneRepublic in February 2022. In the chorus of the song, Tedder belts out:

“I’ve been dreamin’ about the West Coast

Found some faces that I don’t know”

After hearing that song, I immediately grabbed my Songs of Experience album that U2 released in December 2017, over four years before the release of West Coast, and listened to my favorite song on…
